subcategory: Limited opportunities for professional advancement of women in organizations
description: This refers to the systemic barriers women face in career advancement within an organization despite gender equality and diversity initiatives.

content.text: A mindset exists among management and executives that females would leave the job after a certain time and hence there is limited investment in them.
There is unconscious bias and preference towards male managers and leaders.
There are limited networking opportunities for women in the workplace as they are often excluded from informal socializing, such as daily cigarette breaks and chit-chat.
Organizations should initiate programs for leadership and development specifically for females.
Top management should be presented with the value proposition that women bring to the table, such as they are 35% more ethical than men.
Organizations should introduce and highlight the importance of female networks so they feel strong within themselves.
Organizations should work on creating working flexibility and equitable platforms where females feel safe to take up more responsibility.
Organizations should introduce training and awareness sessions to change the mindset of (male) senior managers regarding the potential of female employees and reduce unconscious bias.
